content2.h3: 2009. The Night Sea: transitions and recurrences
content2.p: This 50 minute work is planned to be performed together with a work by Ligeti and one by Lutoslawski, probably in London and Birmingham, followed by a studio recording, if funds allow. Venues and dates to be decided. Further information to be uploaded when available.
Conductor: Steven Gonzalez. Players to be recruited.
content2.h3: November 2008. Sacred Music Through the Ages
content2.p: This concert on 1st November by the Kingfisher Chorale, conducted by Giles Turner in The Emmanuel Church, Loughborough, included the choral version of Invocations to Archangels. Other works were by William Byrd, J.S.Bach, Peter Crump and Arvo Paart. A review appeared in the Leicester Mercury of 6th November.
On the afternoon of Sunday 31st August, between 3 and 5 o'clock, I was interviewed by Bernard Davis on South Birmingham Community Radio. The following of my music was played (see Compositions):

ul.li: He Would Send Me Running (Marion Griffin)

content2.h3: April 2008 … the Isle is Full of Music …
content2.p: This full length concert, shared with friend and fellow composer Raymond Head, took place to great acclaim at the Holywell Music Room, Oxford on 20th April 2008, and at the Arena Foyer, Birmingham Conservatoire, on April 24th 2008. A review appeared in Tempo No.246, Oct. 2008, pp58-59.
The players were Wendy Nieper, soprano, Kirsten Johnson, piano & Christopher Britton, flute.
My songs performed with piano were:

ul.li: He Would Send Me Running (Marion Griffin)
But a Part of it All (James Kavanaugh)
Save now we pray (bell hooks) premiere
Three Hokku on Time (composer's text) premiere

content2.p: and four songs from The Night Sea, arranged for piano & two also with flute

ul.li: The Last Invocation (Walt Whitman) - with flute
The Coming of Light (Mark Strand) premiere - with flute
